alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 05 at 1:04PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Heavy rainfall producing thunderstorms have become anchored across far eastern Charleston and Berkeley counties. The heaviest rain is falling from around Awendaw to McClellanville to the Santee River, as well as portions of the Francis Marion National Forest. National Weather Service radar estimates that 1 to 2 inches of rain has fallen, and heavy rain will continue early this afternoon. The heavy rain will likely cause hazardous travel conditions along Highway 17 from around Awendaw through McClellanville and to the Santee River. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McClellanville, Awendaw, Jamestown, Hampton Plantation State Park, Santee Coastal Reserve, Lighthouse Island, Cape Romain, Cape Island, Tibwin, Buck Hall, Germantown, South Santee, Halfway Creek, Newland, Shulerville, Simmonsville and Palmerville.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
